signals.title: CRISPR Epigenetic Editing Breakthrough: Gene Activation Without DNA Cutting
signals.summary: UNSW Sydney researchers developed a new form of CRISPR technology that activates genes by removing methyl groups without cutting DNA, potentially making gene therapy safer. This epigenetic editing approach avoids cancer risks associated with DNA cutting and has been published in Nature Communications.
signals.raw_content: The latest version, known as epigenetic editing, takes a different approach - by removing methyl groups from genes that have been silenced, researchers can restore gene activity without altering the underlying DNA sequence. Whenever you cut DNA, there's a risk of cancer, and this approach avoids those risks.

signals.title: Real-Time Plant Respiration Monitoring Technology
signals.summary: Scientists created a breakthrough method to watch plants breathe in real-time and high definition, tracking exact carbon and water exchange with air. This could unlock development of crops that grow smarter, stronger, and more drought-resistant.
signals.raw_content: Scientists have created a new way to watch plants breathe—live and in high definition—while tracking exactly how much carbon and water they exchange with the air. The breakthrough could help unlock crops that grow smarter, stronger, and more drought-resistant.

signals.title: Quantum Computing Hardware-Software Co-Design Strategy (SurgeQ)
signals.summary: New research on SurgeQ presents a hardware-software co-design strategy for superconducting quantum platforms employing coupling-strengthened faster two-qubit gates while mitigating crosstalk through tailored scheduling. Accepted by DATE 2026 conference.
signals.raw_content: SurgeQ, a hardware-software co-design strategy for superconducting quantum platforms that employs coupling-strengthened faster two-qubit gates while mitigating crosstalk through tailored scheduling. Work accepted by DATE 2026.

signals.title: Quantum Computing Accelerates Machine Learning Training Time
signals.summary: Quantum computing is demonstrating ability to speed up machine learning algorithms and reduce time needed to process vast datasets. Large language models like those used by ChatGPT could potentially be trained in hours rather than weeks through quantum acceleration.
signals.raw_content: At the intersection of quantum computing and AI, quantum computing is showing it can speed up machine learning algorithms and reduce the time needed to crunch through vast datasets, meaning algorithms like large language models used by ChatGPT could be trained in hours rather than weeks.

signals.title: DeepSeek R1: Chinese Open-Source AI Model Shocks Silicon Valley
signals.summary: DeepSeek released R1 in January 2026, shocking the AI industry. MIT Technology Review predicts more Silicon Valley apps will ship on top of Chinese open models in 2026, with the lag between Chinese releases and Western frontier shrinking from months to weeks.
signals.raw_content: The last year shaped up as a big one for Chinese open-source models, with DeepSeek releasing R1 in January and shocking the world. In 2026, expect more Silicon Valley apps to ship on top of Chinese open models, with the lag between Chinese releases and Western frontier shrinking from months to weeks.

signals.title: AI Economic Impact Measurement: High-Frequency Dashboards Emerge
signals.summary: Stanford HAI experts predict 2026 will see emergence of high-frequency AI economic dashboards with monthly updates rather than years-later data. This follows their 'Canaries in the Coal Mine' work with ADP showing early-career workers in AI-exposed occupations experiencing weaker outcomes.
signals.raw_content: Arguments about AI's economic impact will give way to careful measurement, with the emergence of high-frequency AI economic dashboards. Similar to their Canaries in the Coal Mine work with ADP showing early-career workers in AI-exposed occupations experiencing weaker outcomes, indicators will be updated monthly rather than years later.

signals.title: AI Sovereignty Movement Gains Global Momentum
signals.summary: AI sovereignty will gain huge steam in 2026 as countries try to show independence from AI providers and the United States political system. This trend reflects growing concerns about technological independence and national security.
signals.raw_content: AI sovereignty will gain huge steam as countries try to show independence from AI providers and the United States' political system.

signals.title: IMF World Economic Outlook Update (January 2026)
signals.summary: IMF scheduled press briefing for World Economic Outlook Update on January 19, 2026 at 10:30 AM CET. Previous projections indicated global growth at 3.3% for both 2025 and 2026, below historical average of 3.7%, with global headline inflation declining to 3.5% in 2026.
signals.raw_content: Global growth is projected at 3.3 percent both in 2025 and 2026, below the historical (2000–19) average of 3.7 percent. Global headline inflation is expected to decline to 4.2 percent in 2025 and to 3.5 percent in 2026.

signals.title: Renewables to Surpass Coal as Largest Electricity Source by Mid-2026
signals.summary: IEA Renewables 2025 report forecasts renewables will surpass coal by end of 2025 or mid-2026 at latest to become largest source of global electricity generation. Share of renewables in global electricity generation projected to rise from 32% in 2024 to 43% by 2030.
signals.raw_content: Renewables are expected to surpass coal at the end of 2025 (or by mid-2026 at the latest, depending on hydropower availability) to become the largest source of electricity generation globally. The share of renewables in global electricity generation is projected to rise from 32% in 2024 to 43% by 2030.

signals.title: EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) Enters Full Implementation
signals.summary: Starting January 1, 2026, the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism moves from transitional period into definitive application phase, placing charges on certain imports of carbon-intensive goods including steel, cement, aluminum, and fertilizers.
signals.raw_content: Starting January 1, 2026, the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (EU CBAM) moves from its transitional period into the definitive application phase, placing charges on certain imports of carbon-intensive goods into the EU, including steel, cement, aluminum, and fertilizers.

signals.title: Carbon Engineering's Stratos: World's Largest Direct Air Capture Plant
signals.summary: By 2026, Carbon Engineering's Stratos facility in Texas will capture between 500,000 and 1 million tons of CO2 annually, making it the world's largest DAC (Direct Air Capture) plant. Three companies dominate carbon capture: Climeworks, Carbon Engineering, and SLB Capturi.
signals.raw_content: By 2026, Carbon Engineering's Stratos facility in Texas will capture between 500,000 and 1 million tons of CO₂ annually, making it the world's largest DAC plant. Three companies now dominate this space: Climeworks, Carbon Engineering, and SLB Capturi.

signals.title: CFR Identifies Five Major Foreign Policy Trends for 2026
signals.summary: Council on Foreign Relations experts identified five major foreign policy trends shaping 2026, including critical minerals geopolitics, continuing change in regional security architectures, and intensifying geopolitical rivalry with uncertain progress on U.S. critical-minerals supply chain security.
signals.raw_content: 2026 is expected to be marked by continuing change in regional security architectures and intensifying geopolitical rivalry, with uncertain progress on U.S. critical-minerals supply chain security.

signals.title: South Korea Gen Z Shows 33% Population Share, MZ Generation Dominance
signals.summary: MZ Generation (Millennials and Gen Z combined) makes up 33% of South Korea's population as of November 2025. Over half of Gen MZ live in or around the Seoul metropolitan area. Characterized by YOLO (prioritizing personal happiness), 'meaning out' (value-based consumption), and 'flex' (consumption to show existence).
signals.raw_content: The MZ Generation makes up 33% of South Korea's population as of November 2025. Over half of Gen MZ live in or around the Seoul metropolitan area. Gen MZ in Korea is characterized by YOLO (prioritizing personal happiness), meaning out (value-based consumption), and flex (consumption to show off one's existence).

signals.title: Gen Z Gravitates Toward Intentional Living and Emotional Grounding in 2026
signals.summary: Major theme for Gen Z in 2026 is intentional living and emotional grounding, with the generation gravitating toward slower, more meaningful experiences that provide emotional comfort and stability. This represents a shift away from fast-paced consumption patterns.
signals.raw_content: A major theme for Gen Z in 2026 is intentional living and emotional grounding, with the generation gravitating toward slower, more meaningful experiences that provide emotional comfort and stability.

signals.title: Wellness Trends 2026: Nervous System Regulation and Soft Wellness
signals.summary: 2026 wellness trends focus on stimulating the vagus nerve for stress regulation, mind-body practices around nervous system regulation and emotional balance. Movement away from hustle culture toward 'soft wellness' - a gentler, more mindful approach to health. Includes sound baths, astrology sessions, moon ceremonies.
signals.raw_content: In 2026, we'll focus on stimulating the vagus nerve, a key pathway in the body's stress-regulation system. Mind-body practices that surround nervous system regulation, resilience and emotional balance are emerging as core wellness pillars. As we move away from the pressures of hustle culture, 2026 is shaping up to be the year of soft wellness.

signals.title: NASA Selects Technology for Habitable Worlds Observatory
signals.summary: NASA announced selection of industry proposals to advance technologies for Habitable Worlds Observatory concept - the first mission that would directly image Earth-like planets around stars like our Sun and study their atmospheres for signs of life.
signals.raw_content: NASA announced the selection of industry proposals to advance technologies for the agency's Habitable Worlds Observatory concept – the first mission that would directly image Earth-like planets around stars like our Sun and study the chemical composition of their atmospheres for signs of life.

signals.title: First-Ever ISS Medical Evacuation: Crew-11 Returns Early
signals.summary: NASA returning four astronauts to Earth early from ISS due to medical concern, marking first time in U.S. history and ISS program that a space mission has been cut short due to medical issue. SpaceX Crew-11 undocking targeted for no earlier than Jan 14, 2026.
signals.raw_content: This marks the first time in U.S. history, as well as in the ISS program, that a space mission has been cut short due to a medical issue. NASA and SpaceX are targeting no earlier than 5 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 14, for the undocking of the agency's SpaceX Crew-11 mission.

signals.title: Artemis II Lunar Flyby Mission Set for February 2026
signals.summary: NASA announced earliest launch window for Artemis II is Feb 6, 2026, with 12 possible dates from February-April. Mission will send astronauts around the Moon on ten-day lunar flyby, first crewed lunar flyby since Apollo program.
signals.raw_content: NASA announced that the earliest launch window for Artemis II is Feb. 6, 2026, with 12 more possible dates available from February-April. NASA plans to launch the Artemis 2 mission on the Space Launch System sending astronauts around the Moon on a ten-day lunar flyby in early February 2026.

signals.title: xAI Raises Record $20 Billion Funding Round
signals.summary: First full week of 2026 brought a $20 billion funding round for Elon Musk's xAI, marking one of the largest venture deals ever recorded. Signals continued massive capital deployment in AI infrastructure.
signals.raw_content: The first full week of 2026 brought a $20 billion funding round for Elon Musk's xAI, marking one of the largest venture deals ever recorded.

signals.title: AI Startups Dominate VC: 58% of Funding in Megarounds Over $500M
signals.summary: More than half of all VC dollars and 36% of total deals now flow to AI companies. Two out of every three VC dollars went to AI ventures in 2025. In AI sector, 58% of funding was in megarounds of $500 million or more, with 2025 AI startup funding reaching $131.5B, growing 52% while non-AI funding dropped 10%.
signals.raw_content: More than half of all VC dollars—and 36% of total deals—now flow to AI companies. Two out of every three VC dollars went to AI ventures in 2025. AI startups attracted about 131.5 billion dollars in venture funding, growing roughly 52 percent while funding to non AI startups slipped almost 10 percent. In AI, 58% of funding was in megarounds of $500 million or more.

signals.title: Boston Dynamics Atlas: Electric Humanoid Robot Deployments Begin
signals.summary: Boston Dynamics unveiled all-new Electric Atlas at CES 2026, a high-performance enterprise-grade humanoid robot for industrial tasks from material handling to order fulfillment. 2026 deployments fully allocated, with initial fleets shipping to Hyundai's RMAC and Google DeepMind.
signals.raw_content: Boston Dynamics unveiled its all-new Electric Atlas, a high-performance, enterprise-grade humanoid robot designed to carry out a wide range of industrial tasks, from material handling to order fulfilment. Boston Dynamics' Atlas deployments for 2026 are already fully allocated, with initial fleets set to ship to Hyundai's Robotics Metaplant Application Center (RMAC) and Google DeepMind.

signals.title: Hyundai Plans 30,000 Humanoid Robots Annual Production by 2028
signals.summary: Hyundai announced at CES 2026 plans to start using humanoid robots in its factories and is building production system that could produce 30,000 robots annually by 2028. Part of broader AI Robotics Strategy to lead human-centered robotics era.
signals.raw_content: Hyundai said at CES 2026 that it plans to start using humanoid robots in its factories and is building a production system that could produce 30,000 robots annually by 2028.

signals.title: World's First Production Solid-State EV Battery: 5-Minute Charging
signals.summary: Donut Lab unveiled production-ready solid-state EV battery at CES 2026 that recharges fully in five minutes. Battery has 400 Wh/kg energy density (double typical Tesla battery) and can be fully charged in 5 minutes for up to 100,000 cycles. Verge Motorcycles TS Pro to be first production vehicle with all-solid-state battery in Q1 2026.
signals.raw_content: Donut Lab unveiled a production-ready solid-state EV battery at CES 2026 that recharges fully in five minutes. The battery has an energy density of 400 watt-hours/kilogram, which is double the density of a typical Tesla battery, and can be fully charged in five minutes for as many as 100,000 cycles.

signals.title: CATL Sodium-Ion Batteries to Enter Mass Production in 2026
signals.summary: Battery market leader CATL announced commercial production at scale of sodium-ion batteries starting in 2026 for battery swapping systems, passenger vehicles, commercial vehicles, and stationary storage. Sodium-based batteries promise better low-temperature performance, improved safety, and lower costs than lithium.
signals.raw_content: Battery market leader CATL announced that it would start commercial production at scale of sodium-ion batteries in 2026. The company said its sodium-ion cells will be used in battery swapping systems, passenger vehicles, commercial vehicles, and stationary energy storage. Sodium-based batteries promise better low-temperature performance, improved safety, and lower costs.

signals.title: South Korea Semiconductor Exports Projected to Reach $188B in 2026
signals.summary: South Korea's semiconductor exports in 2026 projected to reach $188 billion, an 11% increase compared to last year, marking new all-time high for second consecutive year. Korean chipmakers expected to increase spending on semiconductor manufacturing equipment by 27.2% to $29.66B.
signals.raw_content: South Korea's semiconductor exports in 2026 are projected to reach $188 billion, an 11% increase compared to last year. This would mark a new all-time high for the second consecutive year. South Korean chipmakers are expected to increase spending on semiconductor manufacturing equipment by 27.2% to $29.66 billion.

signals.title: AI Integration Shifts from Pilot Projects to System-Wide Education Strategy
signals.summary: 2026 marks transition from experimental AI adoption to system-wide integration in education. AI shifting from pilot projects to natural part of daily classroom experiences, firmly cemented as essential part of institutional strategy. Hyper-personalized learning becoming standard with AI adapting instruction based on individual readiness.
signals.raw_content: 2026 is poised to mark a transition from experimental AI adoption to system-wide integration, with AI shifting from pilot projects to a natural part of daily classroom experiences. AI is no longer a collection of pilots and curiosities but is firmly cemented as an essential part of institutional strategy.

signals.title: US Stablecoin Regulation: GENIUS Act Implementation by July 2026
signals.summary: GENIUS Act creates federal regulatory framework for stablecoin issuers, mandating requirements around reserves, audits, and financial integrity. Regulators expected to promulgate final implementing regulations by July 2026, ahead of January 2027 deadline to bring GENIUS into force.
signals.raw_content: The GENIUS Act creates a federal regulatory framework for stablecoin issuers, mandating requirements around reserves, audits, and financial integrity, with regulators expected to promulgate final implementing regulations by July 2026, ahead of a deadline of January 2027 to bring GENIUS into force.

signals.title: Federal Reserve 'Skinny' Master Accounts for Fintech by Q4 2026
signals.summary: On December 19, Fed issued RFI on 'skinny' master accounts providing access to Federal Reserve payment rails while limiting features like discount window access. FRB's goal is to have skinny master accounts available by Q4 2026, enabling fintech access to Fed infrastructure.
signals.raw_content: On December 19, the Fed issued a request for information seeking public input on so-called skinny master accounts, which would provide access to Federal Reserve payment rails while limiting or excluding features such as discount window access. The FRB's goal is to have skinny master accounts available by the fourth quarter of 2026.

signals.title: Labor Market Enters 'Low-Hire, Low-Fire' Era with 11.7% Jobs Automatable
signals.summary: November MIT study found 11.7% of jobs could already be automated using AI. 2026 predicted as 'year of agents' as software expands from making humans productive to automating work itself. Labor market forecast for 'low-hire, low-fire' trend with companies hoarding talent while using AI to fill gaps. Jobs with more AI exposure seeing slower job growth, especially among younger workers.
signals.raw_content: A November MIT study found an estimated 11.7% of jobs could already be automated using AI. 2026 will be the year of agents as software expands from making humans more productive to automating work itself. There are no signs of large-scale job displacement, but jobs with more AI exposure have seen slower job growth, especially among younger workers.

signals.title: AI Workers Save 2 Hours Daily but Only 25% Receive Formal Training
signals.summary: Workers report saving average of two hours per day using AI tools, yet only 25% receive formal AI training from employers. Workers with AI expertise can command salaries up to 56% higher than peers, more than double the premium from year before. Highlights significant training gap organizations need to address in 2026.
signals.raw_content: Workers report saving an average of two hours per day using AI tools, yet only 25% receive formal AI training from their employers, highlighting a significant training gap. Workers with AI expertise can now command salaries up to 56% higher than peers, more than double the premium from the year before.

signals.title: US-China Tech De-escalation: Rare Earth Export Controls Suspended
signals.summary: Beijing retaliated to US semiconductor controls with rare-earth export licensing requirements. Escalation jolted global markets, forcing emergency consultations in Busan where both sides agreed to tentative one-year suspension of measures. US-China relations entering 2026 with paradox: trade thawing in soybeans/metals while tech war over AI chips hardening.
signals.raw_content: Beijing retaliated with new licensing requirements on rare-earth oxides, metals, and magnet products. The escalation jolted global markets and forced emergency consultations in Busan, South Korea, where both sides agreed to a tentative one-year suspension of their measures. US-China relations are entering 2026 with a paradox: trade is thawing in soybeans and metals, while the tech war over AI chips is hardening.

signals.title: China Reduces Import Tariffs on 935 Items Targeting Tech and Healthcare
signals.summary: Beginning January 1, 2026, China reduced import duties on 935 items to levels below Most-Favored-Nation rates. 2026 tariff schedule includes reductions on critical components for advanced and emerging technologies, renewable energy, and healthcare. Signals pragmatic trade policy shift.
signals.raw_content: Beginning January 1, China will reduce import duties on 935 items to levels below Most-Favored-Nation rates. The 2026 tariff schedule includes tariff reductions on critical components and materials related to advanced and emerging technologies, renewable energy, and healthcare in particular.

signals.title: USC Stem Cell Implant Trial for Vision Restoration in Macular Degeneration
signals.summary: Scientists at USC launching new trial to test tiny stem cell implant that could restore vision in people with advanced dry macular degeneration. Represents breakthrough in regenerative medicine for age-related vision loss.
signals.raw_content: Scientists at USC are launching a new trial to test a tiny stem cell implant that could restore vision in people with advanced dry macular degeneration.

signals.title: AI Sleep Analysis Predicts Future Disease Risk from One Night's Data
signals.summary: Stanford researchers developed AI that can predict future disease risk using data from just one night of sleep, analyzing detailed physiological signals across brain, heart, and breathing. Represents advancement in preventive medicine and early disease detection.
signals.raw_content: Stanford researchers have developed an AI that can predict future disease risk using data from just one night of sleep, analyzing detailed physiological signals across the brain, heart, and breathing.

signals.title: Obesity Drug Access Inequality: Two-Tier System Emerges
signals.summary: King's College London research published January 4, 2026 highlights that breakthrough obesity drugs (GLP-1) are not accessible to everyone, raising concerns about two-tier system where wealth rather than medical need determines access to care. Critical social equity issue in healthcare.
signals.raw_content: King's College London published research highlighting that breakthrough obesity drugs are not accessible to everyone, raising concerns about a two-tier system where wealth, rather than medical need, determines access to care.

signals.title: FDA to Approve First Regulatory T Cell Therapy by Spring 2026
signals.summary: As soon as spring 2026, FDA could approve first regulatory T cell therapy to prevent graft-versus-host disease in bone marrow transplant recipients. Represents major advancement in cell-based immunotherapy.
signals.raw_content: As soon as the spring of 2026, the FDA could approve the first regulatory T cell therapy that could prevent graft-versus-host disease in bone marrow transplant recipients.

next_steps.phase_b: Exploration Scanner - discover new sources through keyword variation and regional expansion
next_steps.phase_c: Link Tracker - trace citations and references from collected signals
next_steps.phase_d: Source Evaluator - evaluate and promote high-quality discovered sources
